reviews.review_msg: 330 is tough, make no mistake! Although the midterm was definitely tricky, Carol provided opportunities to do well on small assignments. She was also generous and added bonus Q's to the final exam to help boost our grades! Put in the work and focus on her lecture notes, it'll pay off.

Carol is an amazing prof. Law courses are always very difficult but explained concepts very well and made lectures interesting. Test heavy as expected, but adds assignments to help boost our marks after the midterm average of just over 50%
Tests are tough, make sure you tab your code. Great lecturer, she really knows how to present detailed information in a comprehensible way. Textbook is helpful but you can get by without it.

NO way you can breeze through this class. She is VERY knowledgable and inspirational!! Lecture notes are very detailed, and yes they are long but it is essential. Do you really rather take your own notes? Wish this class wasn't at 830am though.. I can barely comprehend at that time. If you need help, go get it, exams can be tricky.
Amazing and informative lectures - tough grader, but more than fair.  If you put in the effort you will be successful.

Carol and her TA were very kind and easily available for help. However, I found that the exams were a little unfair. Her lecture notes are extremely long; it is open book with the Criminal Code... The supplemental text book was honestly useless.I think you really must learn how to APPLY the criminal code correctly. Similar to a law class

Exams/Participation/1 Assignment Exams are tough, but all the material is available in her lecture slides (posted online). It's dense, but open book with the criminal code.  Not a lot of info on the assignments, but enough in the lecture notes to understand whats being asked..   Class average 73%.  Passionate teacher. Don't buy textbook.
Lecture slides are in the form of essay looking word documents that are OVER 60 pages long. Hard to keep up.

CRIM 330 is a very easy class. Similar to CRIM 230 you are allowed to bring your criminal code to exams. DONT OVER TAB/HIGHLIGHT. I see everyone coming to the exams with literally EVERY page tabbed and pages with PARAGRAPHS highlighted. Her exams look for specific words, it wont help when you're confused with your own aid. ps. dont buy the textbook
She is awesome. Don't really need to buy book, she makes all her notes available. It is a hard course though.

Carol is fantastic! Basically a law school class, so why not take it with an incredibly poised and elite crown prosecutor? I was fortunate enough to have a very small (J) section!! Her first hand experience in the field means navigating the tricky concepts comes easy with her - shes COOL!!! puts on tunes every day before class to chill everyone out

Carol definitely cares about her students, and gives you ample opportunity to do well. She even provided us with exam prep questions for the midterm and final. This is definitely not a class you can just breeze by through, however, the exams were fair and nothing to be taken by surprise. The presentations help boost your grade up

Carol seems to have good intentions but those are lost in the unrealistic expectations for the class. In a 230 person lecture she would make us pass around an attendance sheet every week that was very disrupting. Exams do not reflect material covered in class and the TA assistants were all over the place.
